ad4599b85caeb58a9c0d611527c4a1d2 (19:43): StoneNewt, you around?

d78f4062e6225cbd9dd887b05eb828ed (19:44): UBDR isto expensive -- they only licence per server and not per server type

d78f4062e6225cbd9dd887b05eb828ed (19:45): I got Ghost, but have never tried to backup a server before... my main concern is weather the SCSI boards are going to be supported from booting from floppy and that type of thing
ad4599b85caeb58a9c0d611527c4a1d2 (20:03): hi ondeed
ad4599b85caeb58a9c0d611527c4a1d2 (20:03): indeed*
ad4599b85caeb58a9c0d611527c4a1d2 (20:04): hi derek_
01e74ed72529335988b33abf8198493f (20:04): I have a question regarding the RAM in laptops
ad4599b85caeb58a9c0d611527c4a1d2 (20:06): shoot
01e74ed72529335988b33abf8198493f (20:06): How to decide of what frequency the RAM should be used?
ad4599b85caeb58a9c0d611527c4a1d2 (20:06): higher the better :\
01e74ed72529335988b33abf8198493f (20:07): 256MB (1 x 256MB) DDR SDRAM (333MHz)  <--- that's shipped from the company
01e74ed72529335988b33abf8198493f (20:07): so to upgrade I got to use the same frequency RAM?
ad4599b85caeb58a9c0d611527c4a1d2 (20:09): you can use a higher frequency as long as the motherboard supports it
01e74ed72529335988b33abf8198493f (20:10): but if there are two sticks, then both of them must be of the same frequency?
ad4599b85caeb58a9c0d611527c4a1d2 (20:10): it helps
01e74ed72529335988b33abf8198493f (20:10): but not required?
01e74ed72529335988b33abf8198493f (20:11): How can I find out how much the motherboard supports?
ad4599b85caeb58a9c0d611527c4a1d2 (20:11): do you use windows?
01e74ed72529335988b33abf8198493f (20:12): but I don't have that laptop yet
01e74ed72529335988b33abf8198493f (20:12): and as I found out, no manual ships with it
ad4599b85caeb58a9c0d611527c4a1d2 (20:13): oh right :\
ad4599b85caeb58a9c0d611527c4a1d2 (20:13): maybe you can phone the supplier and ask
d78f4062e6225cbd9dd887b05eb828ed (20:13): i would recommend always using the same speed / even manufacturer of Mem when available...
01e74ed72529335988b33abf8198493f (20:13): they don't know so much
d78f4062e6225cbd9dd887b05eb828ed (20:13): can cause more problems then its worth to mix types
01e74ed72529335988b33abf8198493f (20:13): rootaccess, "even manufacturer of Mem when available..." ..didn't get this
d78f4062e6225cbd9dd887b05eb828ed (20:14): buy 2 of the exact same chip if you can...
01e74ed72529335988b33abf8198493f (20:14): so is there a way to find out how much frequency the motherboard supports once I get the notebook?
d78f4062e6225cbd9dd887b05eb828ed (20:15): easiest way would be to call the manufacturer
d78f4062e6225cbd9dd887b05eb828ed (20:15): or you could spend some time searching on google with the model number and revision of you motherboard
01e74ed72529335988b33abf8198493f (20:16): not many results for this model :S
01e74ed72529335988b33abf8198493f (20:16): http://h50025.www5.hp.com/hpcom/in_en/11_29_64_5092_EV879PA.html
01e74ed72529335988b33abf8198493f (20:16): and I think this model was only released in Asia Pacific, so that's why not much info on the internet
d78f4062e6225cbd9dd887b05eb828ed (20:20): http://h10025.www1.hp.com/ewfrf/wc/product?product=1841950&lc=en&cc=in&dlc=en&lang=en&cc=in&y=8&x=7
d78f4062e6225cbd9dd887b05eb828ed (20:20): give links to manuals
d78f4062e6225cbd9dd887b05eb828ed (20:21): mabey you will have luck there
01e74ed72529335988b33abf8198493f (20:21): they contain nothing related to the notebook
d78f4062e6225cbd9dd887b05eb828ed (20:21): if not , just click the 'Contact HP' link at the bottom of that page and get someone in chat to check for you
01e74ed72529335988b33abf8198493f (20:21): one is about BWT, another about HP drive..

ad4599b85caeb58a9c0d611527c4a1d2 (21:18): i found a nice set of 110W pc speakers.. for ¬£50

a1fdc344a6e84d5896d853d2eb44d28d (21:23): hello i am wondering, i have a cable that i can use to hook up an rca cable to the microphone port on my sound card so that i may record sound, does anyone know if i can record video by plugging in the yellow rca cable into my microphone port?
1becfb88fded39b9b7b556e1ed9b611b (21:23): no you can't
a1fdc344a6e84d5896d853d2eb44d28d (21:26): StoneNewt: what would be the problem?
a1fdc344a6e84d5896d853d2eb44d28d (21:26): StoneNewt: the bandwidth on the microphone port cannot handle video content?
1becfb88fded39b9b7b556e1ed9b611b (21:27): no, there is no hardware to decde the video signal!
a1fdc344a6e84d5896d853d2eb44d28d (21:27): but if i catted /dev/dsp, i would get the full raw data?
1becfb88fded39b9b7b556e1ed9b611b (21:27): no
a1fdc344a6e84d5896d853d2eb44d28d (21:28): so sound signals and video signals differ in not only the protocol?
1becfb88fded39b9b7b556e1ed9b611b (21:28): you'd get digitsed upto what ever kHz
1becfb88fded39b9b7b556e1ed9b611b (21:28): considering video operates in the MHz area you're stuffed
a1fdc344a6e84d5896d853d2eb44d28d (21:29): i thought both audio and video cables send the same kind of data throught rca, but its up to the reciever to tranlate the signals into picture or sound
a1fdc344a6e84d5896d853d2eb44d28d (21:29): so i would lose a lot of frames, or i would fry my sound card or something, or just get crap data that doesn't mean anything?
1becfb88fded39b9b7b556e1ed9b611b (21:30): they do, just video operates at a WAY higher frequency
1becfb88fded39b9b7b556e1ed9b611b (21:30): neither, you'd get garbage
a1fdc344a6e84d5896d853d2eb44d28d (21:31): that's unfortunate
a1fdc344a6e84d5896d853d2eb44d28d (21:31): i do not have any video caputuring hardware here at hom
a1fdc344a6e84d5896d853d2eb44d28d (21:31): i was hoping i could use a sb live
a1fdc344a6e84d5896d853d2eb44d28d (21:32): are their any other nice tricks, like maybe connecting the rca cable to some part of my motherboard that DOES operate in MHz and then read it off that?
a1fdc344a6e84d5896d853d2eb44d28d (21:32): and write a program to translate the signals into picture?
1becfb88fded39b9b7b556e1ed9b611b (21:32): WTF is going to sample analog at MHz on the mobo?
a1fdc344a6e84d5896d853d2eb44d28d (21:33): s-video is analog?
a1fdc344a6e84d5896d853d2eb44d28d (21:33): i mean, i forgot that rca is analog
a1fdc344a6e84d5896d853d2eb44d28d (21:33): but what about s-zideo or component video?
a1fdc344a6e84d5896d853d2eb44d28d (21:33): like for hdtv, are those analog?
1becfb88fded39b9b7b556e1ed9b611b (21:34): HDTV is the only domestic video signal format that is digital at the video decoded stage
a1fdc344a6e84d5896d853d2eb44d28d (21:35): hmm...i have three wires that look like rca, except one is green, one is blue, and one is red. i wonder if i can do anything with these
1becfb88fded39b9b7b556e1ed9b611b (21:37): RGB s-video usually
a1fdc344a6e84d5896d853d2eb44d28d (21:38): those operate in Mhz as well?
1becfb88fded39b9b7b556e1ed9b611b (21:38): almost certainly
a1fdc344a6e84d5896d853d2eb44d28d (21:39): can i take some wire and hook them up to a pci slot and write a driver that does something with the signals it gets?
1becfb88fded39b9b7b556e1ed9b611b (21:40): erm, the PCI slot is *digital*
a1fdc344a6e84d5896d853d2eb44d28d (21:40): and isn't the RGB s-video alsa digital?
14fc68c2d6aade9efce6a23a5f72b3cc (21:41): i have a system with 3ware 9500s raid 10 accross 4 disks experience disk i/o bottleneck, and suggestions for improving performance on existing configuration?
1becfb88fded39b9b7b556e1ed9b611b (21:41): no, it's analog!
1becfb88fded39b9b7b556e1ed9b611b (21:41): 17:33 < StoneNewt> HDTV is the only domestic video signal format that is digital at the video decoded stage
1becfb88fded39b9b7b556e1ed9b611b (21:41): ^^ *cough*
a1fdc344a6e84d5896d853d2eb44d28d (21:41): oh i thought RGB s-video was hdtv
1becfb88fded39b9b7b556e1ed9b611b (21:41): no it's s-video..
1becfb88fded39b9b7b556e1ed9b611b (21:42): HDTV is HDMI
a1fdc344a6e84d5896d853d2eb44d28d (21:42): okay is that something i can plug into some part of my motherboard and road data off of?
a1fdc344a6e84d5896d853d2eb44d28d (21:43): s/road/read/
1becfb88fded39b9b7b556e1ed9b611b (21:43): not really...
a1fdc344a6e84d5896d853d2eb44d28d (21:43): not like just plug in
a1fdc344a6e84d5896d853d2eb44d28d (21:43): but like take some wires or something
1becfb88fded39b9b7b556e1ed9b611b (21:43): like what?
1becfb88fded39b9b7b556e1ed9b611b (21:44): about the only analog device on the mobo is sound card
a1fdc344a6e84d5896d853d2eb44d28d (21:44): like send some wires from the HDMI plug or whatever and connect them to pci
1becfb88fded39b9b7b556e1ed9b611b (21:44): HDMI = DVI-D + some DRM singals avalible!
a1fdc344a6e84d5896d853d2eb44d28d (21:45): like if i had something that connects to a pci slot but it's not really a card, it's doesn't have anything on it
a1fdc344a6e84d5896d853d2eb44d28d (21:45): then i can weld the wires to that and get a signal
1becfb88fded39b9b7b556e1ed9b611b (21:45): unity: just go out spend 30¬£ on a POS analog TV card.. job done!
a1fdc344a6e84d5896d853d2eb44d28d (21:45): yeah...i guess
a1fdc344a6e84d5896d853d2eb44d28d (21:45): i was hoping for an easy solution
a1fdc344a6e84d5896d853d2eb44d28d (21:45): but it doesn't look like i'm getting one
a1fdc344a6e84d5896d853d2eb44d28d (21:46): okay thanks for your help
1becfb88fded39b9b7b556e1ed9b611b (21:46): that is the easy solution!
a1fdc344a6e84d5896d853d2eb44d28d (21:46): i meant cheap solution
a1fdc344a6e84d5896d853d2eb44d28d (21:51): thanks again
